entity1.name: ink
entity1.description: A liquid or paste used for writing, drawing, printing, or decoration.

entity2.name: skin
entity2.description: The outer covering of the body of a person or animal.

entity3.name: tattooing
entity3.description: A form of body modification where ink is inserted into the skin to create designs, often carrying cultural or personal significance.;;;A form of body modification involving the insertion of pigments into the skin to create designs or symbols, often used for self-expression and cultural significance.;;;A form of body modification where designs are created by inserting ink into the skin.;;;A form of body modification involving the insertion of ink into the skin to create designs, often carrying cultural or personal significance.;;;The act of marking the skin with designs, patterns, or symbols using needles and ink.;;;Skilled professionals who use a combination of technical expertise and creative vision to create tattoos.;;;The practice or art of marking the skin with designs, pictures, or words by inserting pigment into small cuts or punctures.;;;A procedure in which ink is inserted into the skin to create a design or pattern as a form of body modification.;;;Traditional patterns and motifs originating from indigenous cultures, often used in body art.;;;A form of body modification where designs are created by inserting ink into the skin to change its pigment, often used for cultural and personal expression.;;;Permanent designs or patterns made on the skin using needles and ink.;;;A form of body modification where ink is inserted into the skin to create designs, symbols, or pictures.

entity4.name: ancient Egypt
entity4.description: A civilization in northeastern Africa that flourished along the Nile River from about 3100 BCE to 30 BCE.

entity5.name: Asia
entity5.description: The largest continent on Earth, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres.

entity6.name: Europe
entity6.description: A continent that comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia, located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere.

entity7.name: indigenous cultures
entity7.description: A group of indigenous peoples and their associated cultural practices originating from the Polynesian islands in the Pacific Ocean.;;;Refers to the traditional and native societies that have historical continuity with pre-invasion or pre-colonial societies.
entity7.chunkid: The Art of Tattooing5;;;The Art of Tattooing6

entity11.name: Japan
entity11.description: A country in East Asia, located on an island chain between the Pacific Ocean and the Sea of Japan.

entity15.name: hyper-realistic portraits
entity15.description: A style of art that aims to create a high level of detail and realism, making the artwork appear as lifelike as possible.

entity17.name: artist
entity17.description: A person who creates art, in this context specifically referring to someone skilled in the practice of tattooing.;;;An individual who creates art, in this context specifically referring to someone skilled in creating tattoos.

entity18.name: client
entity18.description: The person receiving the tattoo service, who collaborates with the artist to achieve a desired outcome.;;;An individual who seeks or uses the services of a professional, such as a tattoo artist.
entity18.chunkid: The Art of Tattooing11;;;The Art of Tattooing13

entity19.name: Communication
entity19.description: The exchange of information or news among people through speaking, writing, or using some other medium.

entity23.name: design
entity23.description: A plan or drawing produced to show the look and function of something before it is made.

entity24.name: placement
entity24.description: The position or location where a tattoo will be placed on the body.

entity25.name: overall outcome
entity25.description: The final result or end product of the tattooing process, including how it looks and its quality.

entity26.name: workplaces
entity26.description: Places where people are employed and perform work.

entity28.name: celebrities
entity28.description: Famous individuals who are well-known in popular culture.

entity29.name: influencers
entity29.description: Individuals with a significant online following who can sway the opinions and behaviors of their audience.

entity30.name: social media
